cards.name: Vinegar
cards.good: A natural disinfectant that combats odors
cards.bad: The acidity wears down granite or natural stone countertops

cards.name: Hydrogen Peroxide
cards.good: A natural bleaching compound that kills bacteria, viruses, and mold
cards.bad: Can cause mild irritation of throat and eyes

cards.name: Bleach
cards.bad: Reacts with ammonia and acids that create toxic fumes

cards.name: Ammonia
cards.good: Effective at breaking down household grime or stains such as cooking grease and wine stains.
cards.bad: High concentration can cause corrosive injuries to eyes and skin with permanant damages

cards.name: Isopropyl Alcohol
cards.bad: Can damage finished surfaces and certain fabrics. Can create harmful fumes
cards.info: Also known as rubbing alcohol, it can be used as a disinfectant and sterilizer. Due to its high alcohol content, it's not recommended near fire. It evaporates quickly so it can create harmful fumes.

cards.name: Toiletbowl Cleaner
cards.good: Effectively and efficiently cleans and disinfects toilet and combats odors
cards.bad: Most contain acidic chemicals that can be harmful to lungs and skin

cards.name: Mold Remover
cards.good: Reduces spread of mold and eliminates odors
cards.bad: Most contain hydrogen peroxide and bleach. Inhaling it can irritate throat, lungs, and skin.

cards.name: Baking Soda
cards.good: Natural product that is also in food that removes tough stains and odors
cards.bad: Leaves behind a white, dusty residue after it dries

cards.name: Drain Cleaner
cards.good: Effective and efficient way to unclog and clean drains
cards.bad: Contains toxic chemicals that are highly corrosive. Mixing different drain cleaners that contain a variety of toxic chemical can create toxic fumes

cards.name: Oxalic Acid
cards.good: A strong acid that removes rust and tough stains on concrete and metal. It bleaches wood by restoring wood to its natural color
cards.bad: May cause skin irritation from exposure

cards.name: Trichloroisocyanuric Acid
cards.good: Eradicates microorganisms in swimming pools and hot tubs
cards.bad: Fumes can irritate and burn skin, eyes, nose, throat, and lungs

cards.name: Peracetic Acid
cards.info: A colorless liquid that can severly irritate lungs and burn skin and eyes.

cards.name: Chloramine
cards.info: Known as mustard gas from WWI, a yellow to colorless liquid that let out fumes that cause irritation to eyes, nose, and throat. It is less volatile than Chlorine Gas but it stays in water longer.

cards.name: Chlorine Gas
cards.info: Yellow poisonous gas that causes coughing, eye and nose irritation, and shortness of breath.

cards.name: Phosphine Gas
cards.info: Colorless and flammable toxic that causes severe lung irritation and compromises cardiac functions.

cards.name: Chloroform
cards.info: Colorless liquid that quickly evaporates into a gas that is harmful to eyes, skin, liver, kidneys, and nervous system.

cards.name: Nullify
cards.info: Not harmful. Does not clean as intended. The mixture is not compatible and neutralizes its effect.

cards.name: Sodium Hydroxide
cards.good: Known as caustic soda or lye, it's a common ingredient in cleaners and soap. It is safe for use in small amounts.
cards.bad: It is corrosive and cause severe burns.

cards.name: Oven Cleaner
cards.good: Effectively and efficiently fight tough grease and grime
cards.bad: On par with bleach when it comes to toxicity. Most includes sodium hydorxide

cards.name: Hydrochloric Acid
cards.good: Common ingredient in bathroom cleaing supplies that can clean tough stains
cards.bad: Corrosive nature cause irritation and burn to eyes, skin, and throat.
cards.info: Hydrogen chloride can be formed during the burning of many plastics. Hydrochloric acid is found in the gases evolved from volcanoes, particularly ones found in Mexico and South America. Hydrochloric acid is also found in the digestive tract of most mammals.

cards.name: Lemon Juice
cards.good: Best all-natural cleaner due to its low pH and antibacterial properties
cards.bad: Can corrode marble and leave marks and stains.

cards.name: Citric Acid
cards.good: Safe and effective disinfectant that removes mold and mildew
cards.bad: Acidic content that can irritate nose and trigger asthma symptoms

combo.explanation: Mixing Hydrogen Peroxide and Vinegar can create Peracetic Acid. You can use both of these ingredients to keep surfaces clean and disinfected as long as one completely dries before using the other.
Mixing Bleach and Vinegar can create Chlorine Gas. Bleach is recommended to be mixed only with water.
Mixing Bleach and Ammonia can create Chloramine. Bleach is recommended to be mixed only with water.
Mixing Bleach and Isopropyl Alcohol can create Chloroform. Bleach is recommended to be mixed only with water.
Mixing Bleach and Toilet Bowl Cleaner can create Chlorine Gas. Bleach is recommended to be mixed only with water.
Mixing Bleach and Mold Remover can create Chlorine Gas. Bleach is recommended to be mixed only with water.
Mixing Bleach and Oven Cleaner can create Chlorine Gas. Bleach is recommended to be mixed only with water.
Mixing Vinegar and Baking Soda creates a nonharmful, oily mixture. It's not a good combination for cleaning because it is mostly used for volcano eruptions for science fairs.
Mixing Bleach and Drain Cleaner can create Chlorine Gas. Bleach is recommended to be mixed only with water.
Mixing Bleach and Glass Cleaner can create Chlorine Gas. Bleach is recommended to be mixed only with water.
Mixing Trichloroisocyanuric Acid and Oxalic Acid can create Chlorine Gas. Oxalic Acid reacts violently with oxidixing agents.
Mixing Bleach and Lemon Juice can create Chlorine Gas. Bleach is recommended to be mixed only with water.
Mixing Drain Cleaner with a different Glass Cleaner can create Chlorine Gas. Most Drain Cleaners have bleach and other acid that release Chlorine Gas or other hazardous gas.
Mixing Bleach and Citric Acid can create Chlorine Gas. Bleach is recommended to be mixed only with water.
